description: {"blocks":[{"key":"25ekf","text":"This protocol describes a general method for quickly preparing and storing protein samples for the immunodetection of Auxenochlorella protothecoides proteins. The protocol was developed for metal free applications where the metal contents of Auxenochlorella protothecoides cells are of importance to the proteins studied. This protocol should be adapted to optimize sampling conditions for each protein of interest.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":118,"length":30},{"style":"italic","offset":242,"length":15},{"style":"italic","offset":258,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

University of California, Berkeley, Chancellor’s Fellowship

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"d2mas","text":"This protocol should be tailored to your specific protein of interest. For example, if you are also interested in light responsive proteins, you may wish to extract proteins in a specific light regime. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmig3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d25t3","text":"Use only ICPMS grade trace metal free Ultra-pure ICP-MS grade Milli-Q H2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":71,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cime","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u7ad","text":"Review the certificates of analysis for each chemical used to verify potential metal contamination concentrations are minimized.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"duvsj","text":"Collect 108 - 109 cells by centrifugation ( ) using Globe Scientific metal free   or   tubes. Discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":10,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":16,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":80,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":85,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e2059","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"10000","duration":120,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1tg2f","text":"Resuspend the cells in   of trace metal grade   sodium-phosphate,   and protease mixture. Transfer the cell suspension to cold   screw cap tubes containing acid washed beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":46,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":66,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":127,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ah6am","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"2":{"type":"ph","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"","id":0,"number":"7"}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bautl","text":"Wash the cells by resuspending the cell pellet in   of trace metal grade   sodium-phosphate,   and protease mixture. Collect cells by centrifugation (see step 1) and remove the supernatant with a P1000 pipette tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":73,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":93,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3bbg2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"2":{"type":"ph","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"","id":0,"number":"7"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bp9j2","text":"The suspension will be thick and sticky. To collect the rest of the cell suspension, add an additional   of the sodium-phosphate and protease mixture to wash the sides of the tube and transfer all material to the respective   tube containing glass beads. Cells may stick to the P1000 tip so use a P100 to add the extra   of sodium-phosphate and protease mixture. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":103,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":224,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":319,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ck5b9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7fcca","text":"Carefully fill a tube rack with liquid nitrogen to a level where half of the tube is submerged.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ec17","text":"Make sure tubes are not tightly closed and air is allowed to pass through with the cap on.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"14tjk","text":"Liquid nitrogen can displace oxygen and cause asphyxiation. If transporting greater than   of liquid nitrogen, do not accompany the dewar in the elevator. Have someone take the dewar out of the elevator at your floor. Do not cap tubes tightly after flash freezing in liquid nitrogen. Tubes may explode if capped when they warm up. Do not use nitrile or rubber gloves to handle liquid nitrogen. Use cryogenic gloves, closed toe shoes, a lab coat, a cryogenic apron, and a face shield when handling liquid nitrogen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":89,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ulsl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}}}}
